query.prompt:

query.result: 13 We were going with the ten demons. 14 Ah, fierce company! but in the church 15 with the saints, and in the tavern with the gluttons.

Please translate each line literally into English.

query.result: 16 Still to the edge was my intent, 17 to see of the ditch every arrangement 18 and of the people who were burning within.

query.prompt:

19 Come i dalfini, quando fanno segno 20 a’ marinar con l’arco de la schiena 21 che s’argomentin di campar lor legno,
22 talor così, ad alleggiar la pena, 23 mostrav’ alcun de’ peccatori ’l dosso 24 e nascondea in men che non balena.
query.result:
19 As the dolphins, when they signal 20 to the mariner with the arch of the back 21 that they reason to keep their wood afloat,
22 sometimes thus, to lighten the pain, 23 showed some of the sinners the back 24 and hid it in less than a whale.

Please translate each line literally into English.
25 E come a l’orlo de l’acqua d’un fosso 26 stanno i ranocchi pur col muso fuori, 27 sì che celano i piedi e l’altro grosso,
28 sì stavan d’ogne parte i peccatori; 29 ma come s’appressava Barbariccia, 30 così si ritraén sotto i bollori.
query.result:
25 And as on the edge of the water of a ditch 26 stand the frogs purely with the snout outside, 27 so that they hide the feet and the other bulk,
28 thus stood on every side the sinners; 29 but as Barbariccia approached, 30 thus they withdrew under the bubbling.

31 I saw, and also my heart delights in it, 32 one waiting thus, as they encounter 33 that one frog remains and the other leaps;
34 and Graffiacan, who was more against him, 35 threw at him the tangled locks 36 and pulled him up, so that it seemed to me an otter.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 I’ sapea già di tutti quanti ’l nome, 38 sì li notai quando fuorono eletti, 39 e poi ch’e’ si chiamaro, attesi come.
query.result: 37 I already knew the name of them all, 38 so I noted when they were elected, 39 and then that they called themselves, I attended to how.

query.result: 40 “O Rubicante, make that you put 41 the claws on his back, so that you flay him!”, 42 cried all together the accursed.

query.result: 43 And I: “My master, do, if you can, 44 that you know who is the unfortunate one 45 come to the hands of his adversaries.”

query.result: 49 My mother placed me as a servant to a lord, 50 who had generated me from a rogue, 51 destroyer of himself and of his things.
